intro: Verbascum froedinii, commonly known as the Froedini's mullein, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, woolly leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
